TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit EventDeliveryFailedException extends System.SystemException

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when an event that is raised from the host cannot be delivered to the workflow instance. Typically the event is raised from an on a workflow instance. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
The following string is added to the event log when this exception is thrown: Event "{1}" on interface type "{0}" for instance id "{2}" cannot be delivered.
When using a state machine workflow, you might get an exception with the message "Queue '{0}' is not enabled." This happens when the current state of the state machine does not know how to handle a specific event. For example, when some state other than the current state contains the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.EventDrivenActivity> that contains the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.HandleExternalEventActivity> that is represented by the queue '{0}'.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: An error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the error message that explains the reason for the exception.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: An error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the error message that explains the reason for the exception and the <xref:System.Exception> that caused this exception.
